verses.text: Be ye followers of me, even as I also \add am\add* of Christ.
Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I delivered \add them\add* to you.
But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman \add is\add* the man; and the head of Christ \add is\add* God.
Every man praying or prophesying, having \add his\add* head covered, dishonoreth his head.
But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with \add her\add* head uncovered, dishonoreth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaved.
For if the woman is not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it is a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaved, let her be covered.
For a man indeed ought not to cover \add his\add* head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.
For the man is not from the woman, but the woman from the man.
Neither was the man created for the woman, but the woman for the man.
For this cause ought the woman to have power on \add her\add* head, because of the angels.
Nevertheless, neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man in the Lord.
For as the woman \add is\add* from the man, even so \add is\add* the man also by the woman; but all things from God.
Judge in yourselves: Is it comely that a woman should pray to God uncovered?
Doth not even nature itself teach you, that if a man hath long hair, it is a shame to him?
But if a woman hath long hair, it is a glory to her: for \add her\add* hair is given her for a covering.
But if any man seemeth to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.
Now in this that I declare \add to you\add* , I praise \add you\add* not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.
For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there are divisions among you; and I partly believe it.
For there must be also heresies among you, that they who are approved may be made manifest among you.
When therefore ye come together in one place, \add this\add* is not to eat the Lord's supper.
For in eating every one taketh before \add another\add* his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.
What? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise \add you\add* not.
For I have received from the Lord, that which also I delivered to you, That the Lord Jesus, the \add same\add* night in which he was betrayed, took bread:
And when he had given thanks, he broke \add it\add* , and said, Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me.
After the same manner also \add he took\add* the cup, when he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as often as ye drink \add it\add* , in remembrance of me.
For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do show the Lord's death till he shall come.
Wherefore, whoever shall eat this bread, and drink \add this\add* cup of the Lord unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of \add that\add* bread, and drink of \add that\add* cup.
For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh condemnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body.
For this cause many \add are\add* weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.
For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.
But when we are judged, we are chastened by the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.
Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.
And if any man hungereth, let him eat at home; that ye come not together to condemnation. And the rest will I set in order when I come.
